dt-button.name: columnVisibility
dt-button.summary: A single button that controls the visibility of one or more columns
dt-button.description:
This button type creates a single button that can control the visibility of one or more columns in a DataTale (its counterpart `b-button columnsVisibility` will be expanded to a single button for each column). This provides the ability to have show all / hide all buttons that control all of the table's columns or a subset of those columns.
For multiple columns, the button should be given a title using the `b-init buttons.buttons.text` option, which can also be used for a single column control button, although it will automatically be given the column's title text if not otherwise supplied.
dt-button.option: Columns selector that defines the column(s) to include in the column visibility button set. By default this is `-type undefined` which results in all columns being selected, but any of the `-type column-selector` options can be used to define a custom button set.
Control if the columns should be shown or hidden when the button is activated.

example.title: DataTables initialisation: Show all / hide all buttons
Direct initialisation: Show / hide columns with the class `secondary`
